document.masterDocTitle: No Difference In The Juveniles Of Two Tectocepheus Species (Acari: Oribatida, Tectocepheidae)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: No Difference In The Juveniles Of Two Tectocepheus Species (Acari: Oribatida, Tectocepheidae)

subSubSection.paragraph: Larva — Body length (N = 5): 157 – 179 µm, average 168 µm.

Gastronotic region — 12 pairs of notogastral setae present. Setae
c 1 – 3
, da – dp , la – lp and
h 1
.

Ventral region of the idiosoma - epimeral setation (I-III): 3-1-2. Seta
h 3
short, seta
h 2
conspicuously long and solid, both acuminate. Porous areas located on apodemes 2, sejugal and 3.

tritonymph legs antiaxial view. a – left leg I; b – right leg II; c – left leg III; d – right leg IV.

FIGURE 11:
T. sarekensis
SEM-micrographs of exochorion structures.

TABLE 1:
Tectocepheus sarekensis
and
T. velatus
; leg setation of all stages. First development of setae characterized by letters; () = pair of setae; – = no change with regard to the preceding stage; * setation of the adult according to Fujikawa (1988) .

. a – protonymph dorsal view; b – deutonymph dorsal view; c – deutonymph ventral view; d – tritonymph ventral view.

FIGURE 14:
T. velatus
LM-micrographs of tritonymph. a – dorsal view, layered from 17 sequentially focused images; b – ventral view, 11 layered images. Scale bar = 50µm

subSubSection.paragraph: Protonymph — Body length (N = 19): 200 – 237 µm, average 224 µm.
Prodorsum — median prodorsal ridges assuming shape of definitive lamellae. Translamella distinct ridge.

Gastronotic region ( Figure 12a ) — 15 pairs of notogastral setae, setae
p 1
,
p 2
and
p 3
added in this stage.

Ventral region of idiosoma - One pair of genital setae. Epimeral setation (I-IV): 3-1-2-1. Median divided mentotectum; lobes variable in shape; same variation as in
T. sarekensis
nymphs. From this stage irregularly shaped round and slightly elevated spots dispersed over median area between epimeral plates.

Ventral region of idiosoma ( Figure 12c ) — Adanal setae
ad 1 –ad 3
. Three pairs of genital setae (no variation). One pair of short aggenital setae. Formula of epimeral setation (I-IV): 3-1-2-2.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 15: Figures 15:
T. velatus
tritonymph right legs antiaxial view. a – leg I; b – leg II; c – leg III; d – leg IV.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Ventral region of idiosoma ( Figures 12d and 14b ) — Anal setae
an 1
and
an 2
on median margin of anal valves. Five pairs of genital setae (constant). Epimeral setation (I-IV): 3-1-2-3.
Legs ( Figures 15 a-d) — solenidia and chaetome see Table 1.
